CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and live in Bad Neuenahr .

CARDINAL . On DATE Apartment CARDINAL , QUANTITY Turda Street , GPE , the applicants’ property , was seized by the ORG under Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , with payment of compensation , following their decision to leave the country . In appears from the file that the applicants received CARDINAL NORP Lei in compensation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG company , a ORG - owned company responsible for the management of property belonging to the ORG , sold the flat to the then tenants , under PERSON no . LANGUAGE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , by a final decision , allowed an action by the applicants , annulled the seizure as being unlawful and ordered restitutio in integrum .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered restitutio in integrum of the apartment and on DATE informed the ORG company of this .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , by a final decision , dismissed the action lodged by ORG and joined by the applicants against both the ORG company and the former tenants of the apartment , to have the sale declared null and void . The court considered that the sale had complied with the provisions of PERSON no . NORP and had been made in good faith . It also stated that the applicants would receive compensation under PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicants claimed restitution in kind of the apartment under the PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL governing immovable property wrongfully seized by the ORG . So far they have not received any answer .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed an application ( recurs PERSON anulare ) by PERSON , acting at the instance of the applicants , to have the judgment of DATE quashed on the grounds that it was contrary to the provisions of LAW No . CARDINAL of the Convention and to the principle of legal certainty . The court considered that the sale had been made in good faith and observed that the principle of legal certainty had not been infringed , as the sale had preceded the final judgment which ordered restitutio in integrum and , moreover , the former tenants had not been parties in that set of proceedings , therefore the final judgment was not opposable by them .

CARDINAL . NORP The relevant legal provisions and jurisprudence are described in the judgments GPE v. GPE ( [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , ECHR CARDINALVII ) ; PERSON and Others v. GPE ( no . MONEY , § § DATE , ORG CARDINALVII ) ; ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) ; and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE ) .
